harmful_ingredients.name: Methylisothiazolinone
harmful_ingredients.description: Methylisothiazolinone is a chemical compound commonly utilized as a preservative in cosmetics and personal care products. Its primary function is to prevent the growth of bacteria, mold, and yeast, thereby prolonging the shelf life of various skincare, haircare, makeup, and toiletry items. This compound exhibits broad-spectrum antimicrobial properties, effectively targeting a wide range of microorganisms. Phenoxyethanol is known for its stability across different pH levels and temperatures, making it suitable for use in diverse formulations. While it generally presents a low risk of sensitization or allergic reactions, regulatory agencies have established concentration limits to ensure its safe usage in cosmetic products
